instructions:
VARIATION:
SAUSAGE GRAVY ON BISCUITS
8 biscuits
1/2 lb bulk pork sausage
1 tbsp margarine
3/4 cup chopped onion
3 tbsp flour
1/4 tsp white pepper
1/2 tsp savory
1/2 tsp rubbed sage
1 cans *(10 oz)* chicken broth
1 cup milk

Make 2 sausage patties and dust with flour. Follow directions as above except crumble or chop all of the
sausage to be added after making the gravy. Serve over warm biscuit halves.
ingredients: Make 5 sausage patties (one of them smaller) and dust with flour. Melt butter in large skillet and fry
sausage over medium heat for 2 minutes on each side or until browned. Reduce heat to low/warm, carefully
add 2 tbsp water, scatter onion around sausage, cover and cook for 5 or 6 minutes on each side or until
sausage is done. Remove sausage and keep warm. Chop the small patty (or 3 Brown & Serve links) to be
added to the gravy and set aside.
Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of fat or add butter to make 3 tablespoons. Mix flour and spices, turn heat
to low, add mixture and stir constantly for about 2 minutes. Slowly pour in stock, then milk, stirring
constantly. Add crumbled sausage and cook for 2 minutes adding additional liquid if not at desired thickness.
name: Sausage With Country Gravy
